channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Nick Reiner charged with murder of his parents Rob and Michele
item.description: Rob Reiner, the Hollywood director, and his wife Michele were both found dead with stab wounds on Sunday.

item.title: Trump orders blockade of sanctioned oil tankers in and out of Venezuela
item.description: It comes a week after the US seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela, in a move that intensified pressure on its government.

item.title: Police release new video in manhunt for Brown University attacker
item.description: Without a suspect identified, police are asking the public to review CCTV footage of a "person of interest".

item.title: Fifa announces small number of £45 World Cup tickets after criticism of prices
item.description: Fifa introduces a small number of "more affordable" $60 (£45) tickets for all 104 matches at the 2026 World Cup following criticism of its pricing structure for the tournament.

item.title: 'Lost Canadians' citizenship bill now in place
item.description: Bill C-3, which became law in November, makes it easier for children born or adopted abroad by Canadians to become Canadian citizens.

item.title: Only some US lawmakers to see full video of controversial boat strike, Hegseth says
item.description: Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth also said he would not publicly release "a top-secret, full, unedited video" of the 2 September attack

item.title: Trump's chief of staff disputes Vanity Fair story in which she criticises Vance and Musk
item.description: In the interview, Wiles describes Donald Trump as having an "alcoholic's personality" and JD Vance as having been a "conspiracy theorist" for a decade.

item.title: Warner Bros to reject $108bn Paramount bid, reports say
item.description: Warner Bros will reportedly advise its shareholders to vote against the offer as early as Wednesday.

item.title: Trump expands US travel ban to five more countries
item.description: The US will restrict entry of people from Burkina Faso, Mali, Niger, South Sudan and Syria as well as holders of Palestinian Authority passports.

item.title: Second doctor sentenced in Matthew Perry overdose death
item.description: Dr Mark Chavez, one of five people who pleaded guilty in the Friends star's death, was sentenced to eight months of home detention.

item.title: No vote coming on extending healthcare subsidies, US House Speaker says
item.description: Healthcare subsidies for millions of Americans are all but certain to expire in the new year as Mike Johnson confirms the US House won't vote on extension.

item.title: Watch: Drone footage shows extent of flooding in Washington state
item.description: At least one person has died after a second round of heavy rain hit the region, with levee failures prompting more evacuations.

item.title: Watch: Hundreds of skiing Santas hit the slopes
item.description: The skiers flew down the trails dressed as Santa and Mrs Claus at the Sunday River ski area in the US state of Maine to support local charities.

item.title: Watch: What to know about the growing US military presence in Puerto Rico
item.description: A retired US vice admiral talks through the military equipment sent to the island in recent months, and what the build up could mean.

item.title: John Cena takes his final bow, after last ever WWE fight
item.description: The actor and wrestler brought the curtain down on a 24-year career that saw him become one of wrestling's biggest stars.

item.title: Six injured as house explodes in California
item.description: A natural gas line leak triggered the house explosion, injuring six people and damaging several nearby properties.

item.title: Watch: A Niagara Falls wreck and the rescue that saved two Americans
item.description: The barge that wrecked in 1918, famous for a dramatic rescue, is now shifting closer to the falls as recent movements carry it further from its original resting spot.

item.title: Canadians and Americans on a social media ban for everyone under 16
item.description: The BBC asked people in Toronto and DC if they think an Australian-style, under-16 social media ban would work in Canada and the US.

item.title: US military build-up in Caribbean has shadows of the past - but differences are stark
item.description: BBC correspondent Will Grant surveys the similarities and differences between current US-Venezuela tensions and the 1989 invasion of Panama.

item.title: How divides emerged at the heart of Trump’s Maga world
item.description: The next presidential election may seem a long way off, but current frictions within Trump’s coalition suggest the jockeying to succeed Trump is well under way

item.title: What we know about Nick Reiner, son charged in death of director Rob Reiner
item.description: The middle child of the filmmaker and his wife Michele has struggled with substance abuse and worked on a film with his dad.

item.title: 'Everyone says it'll never be me' - Brown University student on surviving two mass shootings
item.description: Mia Tretta was shot in the 2019 mass shooting at Saugus High School in California.

item.title: They were almost American - then Trump cancelled their citizenship ceremonies
item.description: Immigrants from among the 19 countries banned by the Trump administration tell the BBC how their citizenship ceremonies were abruptly cancelled.
